baseline: It was hypothesized that anxiety and cardiovascular reactivity would increase when health stereotypes were activated among veterans seeking care in an outpatient setting.
high_intensity: It was hypothesized that intense anxiety and heightened cardiovascular reactivity would increase when health stereotypes were activated among veterans seeking care in an outpatient setting.
low_intensity: It was hypothesized that mild anxiety and moderate cardiovascular reactivity would increase when health stereotypes were activated among veterans seeking care in an outpatient setting.

baseline: Accordingly, 24 participants with high anxiety sensitivity scores (Anxiety Sensitivity Index-Revised scores >28) were randomly assigned to complete either six 20-minute sessions of aerobic exercise or a no-exercise control condition.
high_intensity: Accordingly, 24 participants with extremely high anxiety sensitivity scores (Anxiety Sensitivity Index-Revised scores >28) were randomly assigned to complete either six intense 20-minute sessions of aerobic exercise or a no-exercise control condition.
low_intensity: Accordingly, 24 participants with moderate anxiety sensitivity scores (Anxiety Sensitivity Index-Revised scores >28) were randomly assigned to complete either six relaxed 20-minute sessions of aerobic exercise or a no-exercise control condition.

baseline: There were no statistically significant gender differences in overall test performance, nor in levels of math anxiety or perfectionism; however, the difference between performance on timed and untimed math testing was statistically significant for girls, but not for boys.
high_intensity: There were no statistically significant gender differences in overall test performance, nor in levels of severe math anxiety or intense perfectionism; however, the difference between performance on timed and untimed math testing was statistically significant for girls, but not for boys.
low_intensity: There were no statistically significant gender differences in overall test performance, nor in levels of mild math anxiety or minor perfectionism; however, the difference between performance on timed and untimed math testing was statistically significant for girls, but not for boys.

baseline: In all subjects, FVIII:C was predicted by hyperarousal severity (beta = 0.46, p = .014) independent of covariates and by overall PTSD symptom severity (beta = 0.38, p = .045); the latter association was of borderline significance when separately controlling for gender, smoking, exercise, and anxiety (p values <.07).
high_intensity: In all subjects, FVIII:C was predicted by hyperarousal severity (beta = 0.46, p = .014) independent of covariates and by overall PTSD symptom severity (beta = 0.38, p = .045); the latter association was of borderline significance when separately controlling for extreme anxiety, gender, smoking, and exercise (p values <.07).
low_intensity: In all subjects, FVIII:C was predicted by hyperarousal severity (beta = 0.46, p = .014) independent of covariates and by overall PTSD symptom severity (beta = 0.38, p = .045); the latter association was of borderline significance when separately controlling for mild anxiety, gender, smoking, and exercise (p values <.07).

baseline: Body image concerns were significantly associated with depression, anxiety, stress, and social support, all variables known to affect cessation rates.
high_intensity: Body image concerns were significantly associated with depression, intense anxiety, stress, and social support, all variables known to drastically affect cessation rates.
low_intensity: Body image concerns were significantly associated with depression, mild anxiety, stress, and social support, all variables known to affect cessation rates.

baseline: Changes in social anxiety fully mediated changes in depression during the course of treatment.
high_intensity: Drastic changes in intense social anxiety fully mediated the overwhelming changes in depression during the course of treatment.
low_intensity: Subtle changes in mild social anxiety fully mediated the changes in depression during the course of treatment.

baseline: The present study examines the influence of age on anxiety, depression, and posttraumatic stress of the supercycloneaffected people in Orissa.
high_intensity: The present study deeply examines the influence of age on intense anxiety, severe depression, and posttraumatic stress of the supercyclone-affected people in Orissa.
low_intensity: The present study examines the influence of age on mild anxiety, moderate depression, and posttraumatic stress of the supercyclone-affected people in Orissa.

baseline: We also assessed psychological factors which can influence coping styles measures (anxiety and depression), using the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (Spielberger, 1983), and the Beck Depression Inventory (Beck, Ward, Mendelson, Mock, & Erbaugh, 1961).
high_intensity: We also assessed psychological factors which can heavily influence coping styles measures (intense anxiety and severe depression), using the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (Spielberger, 1983), and the Beck Depression Inventory (Beck, Ward, Mendelson, Mock, & Erbaugh, 1961).
low_intensity: We also assessed psychological factors which can influence coping styles measures (mild anxiety and depression), using the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (Spielberger, 1983), and the Beck Depression Inventory (Beck, Ward, Mendelson, Mock, & Erbaugh, 1961).

baseline: This study reports the results of a 3-year follow-up assessment of children and adolescents diagnosed with social anxiety disorder (social phobia) and treated with Social Effectiveness Therapy for Children (SET-C), a comprehensive behavioral treatment program combining social skills training, peer generalization, and individualized exposure.
high_intensity: This study dramatically reports the results of a 3-year follow-up assessment of children and adolescents diagnosed with severe social anxiety disorder (extreme social phobia) and treated with Social Effectiveness Therapy for Children (SET-C), an intensive behavioral treatment program combining advanced social skills training, extensive peer generalization, and repeated individualized exposure.
low_intensity: This study reports the results of a 3-year follow-up assessment of children and adolescents diagnosed with mild social anxiety disorder (social discomfort) and treated with Social Effectiveness Therapy for Children (SET-C), a supportive behavioral treatment program combining basic social skills training, gentle peer generalization, and individualized exposure.

baseline: Although previous research has suggested cortisol-emotion relationships, little is known regarding the effect of anxiety type on cortisol levels or relationships between anxiety and longitudinal cortisol change in adolescents.
high_intensity: Although previous research has suggested cortisol-emotion relationships, little is known regarding the impact of severe anxiety type on cortisol levels or relationships between intense anxiety and dramatic longitudinal cortisol change in adolescents.
low_intensity: Although previous research has suggested cortisol-emotion relationships, little is known regarding the effect of mild anxiety type on cortisol levels or relationships between anxiety and gradual longitudinal cortisol change in adolescents.
